name: Uterine Arteriovenous Malformation (UAVM)
chief_complaint: Heavy vaginal bleeding after a recent miscarriage
prognosis: Good with prompt treatment, but risk of recurrent bleeding if not fully treated
description: A rare vascular anomaly where abnormal connections form between uterine arteries and veins, often causing life-threatening hemorrhage. Most commonly occurs after uterine trauma (D&C, cesarean section, or miscarriage). Diagnosis requires Doppler ultrasound or angiography.
